string-array.name: minilock_exception
string-array.item: This file seems to be encrypted for another version of miniLock.
miniLock could not decrypt this file — it might be corrupt.
This file does not seem to be encrypted for your miniLock ID. Check that you are logged in with the correct miniLock ID.
miniLock could not determine the sender of this file.
Your phone do not handle Utf-8. Just Throw it away. Do it.
miniLock could not decrypt this file.
The integrity of this file could not be verified.
Please give the app the right to interact with device storage

resources.string: miniLock uses your email and passphrase to derive your miniLock ID.\nSend your miniLock ID to others so they can encrypt files to you. Encrypt files to friends using their miniLock IDs.
Your email is only used to derive your miniLock ID — it remains completely secret and anonymous.

The passphrase you have entered is too weak. Having a long, unique key is very important for using miniLock. Try using a phrase that makes sense only to you.
We strongly recommend allowing miniLock to generate a key for you:
Please enter a valid email address.

This app is an unofficial porting of Nadim Kobeissi\'s miniLock app for desktop.\n\nOriginal application and porting are both under AGPLv3 License. Checkout Nadim\'s application website for more information about miniLock. Checkout android sources on github

Scrypt
This app uses the fork of haochenx of Will Glozer's java SCrypt implementation 

TweetNacl
https://github.com/InstantWebP2P/tweetnacl-java Copyright(2014-2015) by tom zhou, iwebpp@gmail.com

Blake2s Java implementation
https://github.com/legarspol/java-blake2s
